utterance: Thank you for calling Accounts Receivable Services. I'm Rachel, a virtual agent. How may I help you?
You people keep harassing me. I'm sick of it.
I apologize for any frustration. I'd like to help resolve this. May I have your phone number?
Why? So you can call me more?
I need it to access your account and see how we can help you today.
Whatever. Four zero eight six six six five five five five.
Thank you. That's four zero eight six six six five five five five?
Yes.
May I have your full name?
Lisa Taylor.
And your date of birth?
Why do you need all this information? This is invasive.
I understand your concern. This is required to verify your identity and protect your account information. May I have your date of birth?
Fine. February fourteenth nineteen eighty six.
Thank you, Lisa. This is an attempt to collect a debt. I see a balance of six hundred twenty one dollars and fifteen cents. Would you be able to resolve this today?
First tell me what this is for. I don't even recognize this company.
This is a debt that was originally with MedHealth Partners for medical services rendered in January of twenty twenty five. The account was sent to us for collection in July.
I have health insurance. Why wasn't this covered?
This appears to be the patient responsibility portion after insurance. It's the copay and deductible amount that wasn't covered by your insurance plan.
Nobody told me I owed anything. Your calls are the first I'm hearing about this.
I understand. MedHealth Partners should have sent you billing statements before sending this to collections. Did you perhaps move recently or change your address?
I moved in March. But they should have called me or something.
That would explain why you didn't receive the paper statements. Unfortunately, most medical providers rely on mailed statements rather than phone calls for billing.
So now I'm being punished because I moved?
I understand this is frustrating. However, the debt is valid, and resolving it today would prevent any further collection activity. If I pay this, will you stop calling me?
Yes, once the balance is paid in full, you won't receive any further calls about this account. We can take care of this right now if you're ready.
And this won't affect my credit anymore once I pay it?
Paying it will change the status to paid, which is better than unpaid. However, the collection account may remain on your credit report for up to seven years from the date it first went delinquent.
That's ridiculous. This whole system is designed to screw people over.
I understand your frustration with the process. The best thing we can do now is resolve the debt so it doesn't continue to negatively impact you.
If it gets you off my back, yes. Let's do it.
I appreciate that. We accept Visa and Mastercard. Which would you like to use?
Visa. The number is four five five six six six seven seven eight eight nine nine zero zero one one two two.
Thank you. And the expiration date?
May twenty twenty six.
And the CVV code on the back?
What's that?
It's the three digit security code on the back of your card.
Oh. Seven eight nine zero.
I'm sorry, the CVV should be exactly three digits. Can you verify the code?
I'm looking right at it. It says seven eight nine zero. There are four numbers here.
That's unusual. Standard Visa cards have a three digit CVV. Is there any other number grouping on the back of your card?
No, just this one group of numbers. This is exactly why I hate dealing with you people.
I understand this is frustrating. Let me confirm what you're seeing. You said the CVV is seven eight nine zero, correct?
Yes, that's what it says on my card. Four digits.
Okay, let me try processing this with what you've provided. Is the card in the name Lisa Taylor?
Yes.
And can you confirm your billing zip code?
Nine five one three two.
Thank you. I'm going to attempt to process this payment now. Please hold.
I'm sorry, Lisa, but the CVV code you initially provided had four digits. Our system requires exactly three digits for validation. The payment cannot be processed with invalid card details.
So what, you're saying my card is fake? This is insane.

No, I'm not saying the card is fake. However, standard Visa and Mastercard CVV codes are three digits. It's possible you're looking at a different number on your card. Could you check if there's another three digit number?
I've looked at this card ten times. You know what? Forget it. I'm done with this call.

I understand your frustration. If you'd like to call back when you have the correct information, we're here to help. Would you like me to send you an email with your account details so you can review them?
No, I don't want anything from you people. This whole thing is a scam.
This is a legitimate debt collection attempt, Lisa. Your account information is accurate. If you believe there's an error, you have the right to dispute the debt in writing within thirty days.
I'm not disputing anything. I just wanted to pay and be done with it, but you won't let me.
I want to help you pay this, but I need valid payment information to do so. If you can provide a correct three digit CVV or use a different card, I can process the payment right now.
I don't have another card. This is the only one I have.
I understand. You could contact your card issuer to verify the CVV code, or you could call us back with different payment information when you're ready.
This is a waste of my time. I'm hanging up.
I understand. If you'd like to resolve this in the future, please don't hesitate to call us back. Have a good day, Lisa.
